intro: Campanula florida, commonly known as the bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while the plant can grow up to 3 feet tall. Campanula florida is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in gardens and floral arrangements.
